feed.title: Free the People
feed.subtitle: We are a small, grassroots organization seeking to support the resistance against the oligarchy...

entry.title: Week in Review
entry.summary: Recap of this week in the revolution: Minneapolis nominated for Nobel Peace Prize, Alex Pretti's killers identified, and Kristi Noem may be impeached. Kennedy Center closing under Trump's failed leadership. Trump regime is making plans to take control of 2026 elections. The real story behind Trump's tariff madness.

entry.title: Week in Review
entry.summary: Recap of this week in the revolution: Nationwide protests demand ICE out of our cities. Trump regime targets journalists to silence free press. FBI seizes 2020 voter records in Georgia. Another (partial) government shutdown begins.

entry.title: Week in Review
entry.summary: Recap of this week in the revolution: ICE is not welcome in Minnesota, nor in the United States. The Trump regime still refuses to release the Epstein Files in violation of the law. ICE-stapo murders another in the streets. Trump's dementia is getting worse.

entry.title: Week in Review
entry.summary: Recap of this week in the revolution: Judge limits ICE-stapo violence against peaceful protesters. The Trump regime's plan to undermine and then dismantle public education. Reporter reveals sloppy ICE-stapo recruitment process. Who's next on our national hit list?

entry.title: Week in Review
entry.summary: Recap of this week in the revolution: Celebrating the small victories of 2025. Hegseth demotes retired Navy Captain Mark Kelly as Trump regime cuts funding for poor families in Democratic states. ICE murders 2 U.S. citizens in 8 days. Is our undeclared war with Venezuela legal?

entry.title: Week in Review
entry.summary: Recap of this week in the revolution: Trump regime returns National Guard control to states and Congress releases Jack Smith deposition. DeSantis misuses Florida taxpayer funds. Trump regime illegally abducts President Maduro and seizes Venezuela.

entry.title: Week in Review
entry.summary: Recap of this week in the revolution: Abughazaleh turns campaign office into aid hub. Trump regime desecrates Christmas. CBS pulls CECOT report hours before scheduled broadcast. Trump regime makes a habit of breaking the law.

entry.title: Week in Review
entry.summary: Recap of this week in the revolution: Smith has proof claims of stolen election were criminal conspiracy. Trump regime breaks law requiring release of Epstein files. Dismissed court cases being reopened, bringing new deportation threats to lowest-risk immigrants. Zohran Mamdani demonstrates how we can celebrate our differences with joy and respect.

entry.title: Week in Review
entry.summary: Recap of this week in the revolution: Kilmar Abrego Garcia free again. Trump regime's exposes its own hypocrisy. U.S. citizenship on sale now and U.S. military seizes Venezuelan oil tanker. Beware of surveillance pricing when shopping online.

entry.title: Week in Review
entry.summary: Recap of this week in the revolution: ADM Holsey retires early amid tension over Caribbean strikes and Costco sues Trump regime for tariff refund. Reports of DOGE's death exaggerated. Double-tap on Venezuelan drug boat is a war crime.

entry.title: Week in Review
entry.summary: Recap of this week in the revolution: Comey and James cases dropped. Two Guardsmen shot, one killed in D.C. and ICE-stapo ignores less-lethal weapon guidelines. Trump calls for execution of Democrats promoting lawful disobedience while his regime detains a record number of children. A lawyer lists hundreds of Trump's crimes so far this year.

entry.title: Week in Review
entry.summary: Recap of this week in the revolution: Congress votes to release Epstein files and MTG will resign. Corporations could lose millions as minting of pennies halts. Unqualified Trump regime attorney mishandles Comey case, 97% of ICE detainees in Chicago have no criminal record, and White House offers MBS red-carpet welcome.

entry.title: Week in Review
entry.summary: Recap of this week in the revolution: Epstein files vote imminent. Democrats snatch defeat from the jaws of victory (again) while Noem profits off of taxpayer ad spending. Trump regime pardons are abuse of power. What really happened in Portland?

entry.title: Week in Review
entry.summary: Recap of this week in the revolution: Encouraging election results and jury finds "Sandwich Guy" not guilty of assaulting a federal officer. Government shutdowns breaks records for longest in history. Trump flaunts his wealth while SNAP benefits expire for the poorest. What is democratic socialism?

entry.title: Week in Review
entry.summary: Recap of this week in the revolution: Senate passes resolution to undo Trump tariffs. Kat Abughazaleh targeted by weaponized DOJ and Trump regime to revoke disability benefits. Warships deployed to Venezuela. Updates on the government shutdown.
